title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: When attempting to rename a package, the software does not check if all the resources within the package are writeable. This bug causes an unexpected exception dialog to appear after the renaming process is finished.
OB: The software should check if all resources inside a package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed.
EB: The software allows the renaming of a package even if not all resources within the package are writeable, causing an unexpected exception dialog to be displayed after the renaming process is finished.
SR:
To reproduce: 

1. Create a package with a compilation unit (CU) inside it.
2. Make the CU readonly.
3. Attempt to rename the package.

Observation: After the renaming process is finished, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
